definition: to take out of the furnace/fresh out of the oven/fig. newly announced/recently made available

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
stove/furnace
variant of 爐|炉[lu2]
fresh out of the oven/fig. novelty just announced/recently made available

sentences.english: Hot and fresh out of the dishwasher.
sentences.chinese: 从洗碗机里新鲜出炉的热腾腾的蛋糕。

sentences.english: One could always feel fine smell of just-baked bread.
sentences.chinese: 顾客们始终能在面包店里闻到新鲜出炉的面包香味。

sentences.english: Does the smell of fresh-baked cookies bring you back to your childhood?
sentences.chinese: 刚出炉的面包是否常唤起你童年的回忆？

sentences.english: The first model of the "flying Humvee" is expected at the end of next year.
sentences.chinese: “飞行悍马”的第一款车型预计明年年底将会出炉。

sentences.english: I waited for her cremains by the ashes furnace.
sentences.chinese: 骨灰出炉前我们和火化师父说好在炉前等。

sentences.english: Three other Cabinet positions were to be filled by day's end.
sentences.chinese: 其它三位内阁阁员的名单也预定在今日出炉。

sentences.english: Remove from oven and let cool. Then slice cake into 2 layers.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕出炉后即倒转，待冷切开两层留后用。
刚出炉的小餐包正在特价中。

sentences.english: Zhou Yang waited excitedly for the first copies to be ready.
sentences.chinese: 周扬兴奋地等待着第一批报纸的出炉。

sentences.english: No major economic or earnings reports are due out Monday.
sentences.chinese: 本周一没有主要经济报告或公司财报出炉。

sentences.english: This year, the 5th American Idol is new- ly-publicated.
sentences.chinese: 今年第五季“美国偶像”新鲜出炉。

sentences.english: Fall in the tree, like in this long-lens view, Fall in cars, like just released fresh cream cake.
sentences.chinese: 落在汽车上，就像刚刚出炉的新鲜奶油蛋糕。

sentences.english: The new forged kitchen knife range from Victorinox.
sentences.chinese: 维氏系列厨刀新鲜出炉。

sentences.english: Cheshire has promised a more detailed plan by next month.
sentences.chinese: 柴什承诺下个月将有更详细的方案出炉。

sentences.english: There are, however, downsides to anything this new and major.
sentences.chinese: 不过，这种新鲜出炉又意义重大的事物总会有不足的。

sentences.english: All the same, nobody should have been surprised at the seeding of the play-offs this year in particular.
sentences.chinese: 看看吧，今年附加赛的分档出炉时，有谁曾感到惊讶？

definition: fresh out of the oven/fig. novelty just announced/recently made available
to announce/to make public/to publish
to announce publicly/to publish/to make known/to disclose
to release/to issue/to announce/to distribute/also written 發布|发布[fa1 bu4]
to release/to issue/to announce/to distribute
list of names
the charts (of best-sellers)/table of ranking
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
to select on the basis of a vote or consensus
variant of 榜[bang3]
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
heavyweight/serious
latest/newest
to preheat/warm-up
to get past the qualifying round/to make it to the finals
to test and evaluate
to come to a decision/to fix on (a date etc)/to determine/to finalize/to nail down (a deal etc)
final part of a go game (see 官子[guan1 zi3])/endgame/to finish up/to come to the final stage
